title: PTD Today — Media

items.title: Microsoft SQL Server Innovation on AWS | Let's Talk About Data

ai.summary: Based on the available description… This episode dives into RDS for SQL Server updates announced at re:Invent 2025 — Developer Edition support, M7i/R7i instance support with optimized CPU, and expanded storage up to 256 TiB. It also covers SQL Server 2025 on EC2 plus new cost, storage, compute and tooling features and demos of performance gains on the latest-generation instances.
bullets: RDS for SQL Server: Developer Edition support added.
New instance support: M7i and R7i with optimized CPU.
Expanded RDS storage options up to 256 TiB.
SQL Server 2025 availability and new features on AWS EC2.
Demos highlighting performance gains and cost/optimization tooling.
takeaways: Developer Edition support helps lower Microsoft licensing costs for development and testing.
M7i/R7i instance support and demoed performance gains can improve throughput for production workloads.
Expanded storage to 256 TiB enables hosting significantly larger databases on RDS.
Availability of SQL Server 2025 on EC2 and new tooling provides updated migration and modernization paths.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Daniel Tom, 31, owns and operates Bay Area Sanitation, which runs a fleet of almost 2,000 portable toilets serving construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area. The company reported $4.3 million in total income in 2025 and was featured by CNBC Make It.
bullets: Owner: Daniel Tom, 31
Company: Bay Area Sanitation
Fleet size: almost 2,000 portable toilets
Service area: construction sites and events in the San Francisco Bay Area
2025 total income: $4.3 million
takeaways: Scale matters: a ~2,000-unit fleet and multi-million-dollar income indicate sizable operational scale for a service business in a dense metro area.
Physical-asset businesses generate steady revenue streams that can be relevant when evaluating local service market demand.
Regional coverage across construction and events suggests diverse, recurring demand profiles that support business resilience.
Profiled features like this can help identify nontech infrastructure businesses as potential local partners or customers.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, route planning is made easy—Jo discovers the power of Copilot Groups. The brief description highlights Copilot Groups and includes the tags #copilot, #microsoftcopilot, and #ai.
bullets: Focus: route planning made easy
Feature highlighted: Copilot Groups
Narrative element: Jo discovers the capability
Short promotional description with hashtags
takeaways: If route planning is part of operations, Copilot Groups may be worth evaluating for simplifying planning workflows.
The mention of Copilot and AI suggests this is positioned as an AI-assisted Microsoft Copilot capability to explore with vendors.
A concise demo-style asset like this can serve as a quick intro for stakeholders assessing tools for field/logistics coordination.
Use the short description and tags as an entry point to request a deeper technical or pilot evaluation before procurement.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this KPMG Poland podcast episode explains how AI is already integrated into everyday audit work, automating repetitive tasks, enabling analysis of full data populations, and supporting documentation and disclosures. The hosts present concrete tools (AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI, KPMG Clara and Clara for Clients), discuss the shift from sampling to population analysis, and highlight auditor skill changes, implementation challenges, data security, regulation, and AI-related risks.
bullets: AI is now a routine part of audits, helping with repetitive tasks and large-scale data analysis.
AI Transaction Scoring Tool enables analysis of full populations rather than sampling.
Clara AI offers conversational assistance and specialized agents; KPMG Clara manages audits in real time and Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
Adoption shifts auditor roles and requires new competencies and adaptation.
Key concerns include implementation challenges, data security, regulatory environment, and potential AI risks.
takeaways: Plan infrastructure capacity and performance to support full-population analytics and AI tooling workloads.
Prioritize robust data security, access controls, and compliance measures to meet audit-related regulatory expectations.
Enable real-time data access and integrations to support platforms like KPMG Clara and conversational AI assistants.
Factor in change management and skills development when provisioning systems and support for AI-driven audit workflows.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and features NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The launch trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Arknights: Endfield is a 3D real-time strategy RPG where you play the Endministrator across Talos-II.
The game launch includes support for NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Trailer capture details: GeForce RTX 5080, 4K Ultra settings, DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
Description links to NVIDIA’s DLSS 4 announcement and the Arknights: Endfield official site.
Social channels for the game and NVIDIA GeForce are provided in the description.
takeaways: DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation is being used in a commercial game release—plan GPU procurement to include hardware that supports DLSS 4 if you need to reproduce or support similar workloads (example capture used RTX 5080).
Use the provided RTX 5080 4K capture as a reference point when evaluating GPU capacity for high-resolution real-time 3D rendering and capture workloads.
Include vendor links (NVIDIA and game site) in procurement and testing workflows to verify driver, SDK, and compatibility requirements before deployment.
Content production and visualization pipelines intended to deliver 4K outputs should test DLSS 4 features on target hardware to validate quality and performance.
